items.q: In the story Mrs. Sens ', the radiator continuously hissed likes steam . Continuously hissed like steam is ____. a. a metaphor c. simile b. a point of view d. a definition

The narrator in Winterblossom Garden says his mother was matched to his father. That means ____. a. they had an arranged marriage b. they wore the same color at their wedding c. they had common interests d. they had similar appearances
The mother in Winterblossom Garden is obsessed with food. That means she ____. a. hates to eat c. talks about food all the time b. dislikes cooking d. refuses to serve food to her neighbors
When the mother in Winterblossom Garden gazes at a photograph, she ____. a. talks about it c. looks at it a long time b. ignores it d. looks only quickly at it

In Winterblossom Garden , the narrator cannot resist sitting on the couch and looking at pictures. This means the narrator ____. a. Cannot stop himself from sitting and looking at pictures. b. Is surprised his mother is showing him pictures. c. Insists on staying to see the pictures. d. Doesn't have time to look at the pictures.
In her wedding picture, the mother in Winterblossom Garden has a stunned expression on her face. Her expression shows ____. a. happiness c. surprise b. fear d. depression
The mother in Winterblossom Garden wore a(n) ____ wedding gown in her picture. a. ugly c. drooping b. used d. luminous

In the story Mrs. Sens , the chopping knife might be considered a symbol of ____. a. her former life in her country c. a forgotten romance b. doing things quickly and accurately d. her relationship with her husband
In the story Mrs. Sens , Eliot loses interest in playing on the barren sand by himself. The word barren means ____. a. rocky c. cold b. empty d. gray
Mrs. Sens ____ her chopped vegetables in shallow bowls filled with water. a. threw out c. boiled b. draped d. immersed
Mrs. Sens says that sometimes she can't sleep in her apartment at night because ____. a. the heater makes too much noise. c. there's too much noise outside b. it's too quiet d. it's too cold
The scarlet powder that Mrs. Sens applies to her forehead indicates ____. a. which country she comes from c. How old she is b. she is married d. The number of children she has
Eliot was able to detect Mrs. Sens' familiar scent. The word detect means ____. a. notice c. forget b. honor d. protect
Mrs. Sens enjoyed her food preparation and was reluctant to get up. The word reluctant means ____. a. happy c. unwilling b. excited d. depressed
Mrs. Sens' slippers were ____. a. rarely worn c. each the same color b. each a different color d. brand new
In literature, the point of view is the perspective of the person telling the story.
In the story Winterblossom Garden , the point of view is told by a third person narrator.
A story can be presented from the point of view of any character.
An "omniscient" narrator sees everything going on and can write about what any of the characters are thinking.
The first person narrator tells only the narrator's point of view.
The third person narrator can be used to increase suspense.
It is possible for the reader to distrust or dislike the narrator.
When Eliot visited Mrs. Sens, she sat surrounded by an array of vegetables . In this sentence, the word array means small amount.
Mrs. Sens' home country was India.
The mother in Winterblossom Garden thinks her son would be happy if he got married.
If something is strewn on the floor, it is placed there carefully.
If there is a row of items, they are neatly arranged.
The blade of a knife is the part that cuts.
Hacking is similar to cutting.
You can drape a book on a table.
The mother in Winterblossom Garden likes to take pictures.
The writer of Winterblossom Garden has a sister named Kay.
The writer of Winterblossom Garden wants his mother to take English lessons.
The mother in Winterblossom Garden feeds her son cookies.
The grandfather of the writer in Winterblossom Garden finally returns to China.
The story Winterblossom Garden takes place in New York City.
A trophy is a type of prize.
You can say that a nose protrudes from a person’s face.
If you clutch something, you drop it.
The smallest finger on your hand is called the pinky.
A child’s eyelids droop when she is sleepy.
Mrs. Sens is Eliot’s aunt.
Eliot is bored watching Mrs. Sens cook all the time.
Mrs. Sens never asks Eliot to help her prepare the food.
When Eliot visited Mrs. Sens' house, the radiator made the house as hot as a(n)
Mrs. Sens chopped vegetables with a curved blade that was as sharp as a(n)
Eliot enjoyed the car wash where giant canvas ribbons like hit the windshield.
In her wedding picture, the mother in Winterblossom Garden looks as luminous as a(n)
In the story, Winterblossom Garden, the narrator's Uncle Lao Hsu lost money like a(n) because he gave away his merchandise to pretty women.
Write a short essay that describes an event in your life that happened with a person you remember quite vividly. Describe the person and then the event from the narrator's point of view.
